bug.author: a-maumau
bug.summary: Cube's reset floor is in the air.
bug.description:
Position resetting floor/tile of a cube is sometimes in the air. Is this expected? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16185203/53237147-4da56980-36d9-11e9-8273-001da6e0cf22.png></denchmark-link>
In my case, it was above of a high-level ground (extruded floor). My environment is macOS 10.14.3, v1.2 and played by myself. also it might be another issue or is expected, but sometimes if I touch the reset floor, the cube which I did not touch moves to different position which seems to be an initial position. ( I'm not sure on this. It just might be my imagination or something...)

comments.comment: It seems it is always in the air if the reset floor is placed on the high-level ground.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/a-maumau>@a-maumau</denchmark-link>
Thanks for pointing this out. It is indeed a bug, and we will work to fix it in the next release.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/miha-skalic>@miha-skalic</denchmark-link>
I believe so. Both are related to the cube and it's reset area not being placed correctly. This will be addressed in the Round 2 release.

I opened <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/obstacle-tower-env/issues/80>#80</denchmark-link> for the cube-stuck-in-floor bug. Didn't see that it was mentioned in this issue until now.
Hi all. These issues should be addressed in the v2.0 release. Please re-open the thread if they are still occuring.
